homepage.introduction: This is BD4VQK. Welcome to my page.
homepage.qsl-address:
Blk 25 Sispark, 328 Xinghu Jie
Suzhou Industrial Park
Suzhou, Jiangsu Province
China 215123
homepage.qsl-info-1: Please DO NOT write only my callsign as the recipient. My name is required since the mailbox is shared with others. It will not be delivered to me if there is not my name on it.
homepage.qsl-info-2: QSL via QRZ and LoTW are preferred. Please contact me via email if you need more details.
homepage.qsl-info-3: Please send to the address above instead of bureau or it may NOT be able to deliver to me.
homepage.qsl-info-4: QRZ contains more fields than LoTW so the information from QRZ will take precedence if conflicts exist.
homepage.license-info-3: See {0} for details about frequencies and power limits of different license classes.
homepage.station-1-description: My first radio station to get my callsign.
homepage.station-2-description: My base station at home, for HF and 50MHz band.
homepage.station-3-description: A portable station used for operating outdoors and satellite communication. You will see a suffix /QRP on HF to indicate that I am using this station.
homepage.antenna-2-description: A Yagi with 7 UHF and 4 VHF elements, for satellite communication.
homepage.antenna-3-description: An end-fed HF antenna, used horizontally by the window at home, or vertically on a tripod when operating outdoors.
homepage.frequency-hf-bands: Usually operate on the following bands:
homepage.frequency-hf-info-1: You will often see me on FT8 frequencies of these bands, but also the SSB/CW frequencies on 40m/20m/15m/10m bands.
homepage.frequency-hf-info-2: Personally, I like CW more. You are welcome to contact me any time when you receive my call.
homepage.frequency-hf-info-3: If my callsign is attached with a /QRP, it means that I am using my QRP station with 5W power. QRP contact are challenging and it requires better propagation and antenna. Your QSO will be my best encouragement.
homepage.frequency-hf-info-4: Note: my callsign on your logbook shall be the same as what I send (i.e. DO NOT remove the prefixes or suffixes by yourself), otherwise the logs may not be able to be confirmed.
homepage.frequency-vhf-6m-info-1: Due to its special propagation characteristics, I will only use "the most efficient and safe" FT8 mode to communicate at 50.313MHz.
homepage.frequency-vhf-6m-info-2: By regulation, the maximum power limit on VHF is 25W. It is normal that you may find my signal strength not very strong.
homepage.frequency-vhf-6m-info-3: Similarly, you may meet me with /QRP suffix, which means I am using my QRP station.
homepage.frequency-vhf-2m-info-1: This is mainly for satellite communications. By regulation I am able to transmit on 146MHz-148MHz as well, but it is not for amateur satellites so I am not using this part very often.
homepage.frequency-vhf-2m-info-2: Right now I do not have any assistance for adjusting antenna azimuth, elevation, and Doppler. All of them are done manually. Usually I operates at ground level outdoors, focusing on FM because I am unable to bring many devices for digital satellites.
homepage.frequency-vhf-2m-info-3: Sometimes I will participate in communications via local repeaters, which will be logged on QRZ. If you need confirmation, remember to expand the "Propagation" section and select "Terrestrial or atmospheric repeater or transponder".
homepage.footer: 73, and hope to see you on the air.
